title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Designation of military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and Secretary of Commerce respectively. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations recommended for closure as redevelopment areas within 60 days of closure recommendation. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment within 60 days of closure recommendation. Enterprise zones designated under this Act are in addition to existing enterprise zones authorized under another Act. Funding for designated enterprise zones may come from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or the Secretary of Commerce. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment within 60 days of closure recommendation. Funding for designated enterprise zones may come from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce to provide economic adjustment assistance. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area remains in effect for 5 years, with annual reviews conducted by the Secretary of Commerce. The term "substantial realignment" refers to a significant reduction in the operation of a military installation where 50 percent or more of personnel are reassigned or transferred to another military installation. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are met regarding commercial use priorities. Congress states that buildings or properties on military installations must no longer be considered for redevelopment if they are not consistent with the designated redevelopment area.
